sentences.sContent: The country now faces an economic crisis .
sentences.sCn: 该国目前正面临一场经济危机。

sentences.sContent: The Prime Minister was criticized for the way in which he handled the crisis .
sentences.sCn: 首相处理危机的方式遭到了批评。

sentences.sContent: I was relieved that we had averted yet another financial crisis .
sentences.sCn: 我如释重负，我们又避免了一场财政危机。

sentences.sContent: Oil companies were heavily criticized when they made large profits during the oil crisis of the 1970s.
sentences.sCn: 石油公司因在20世纪70年代的石油危机中赚取了丰厚利润而受到严厉抨击。

sentences.sContent: The car industry is now in crisis .
sentences.sCn: 汽车工业现在正处于危机之中。

sentences.sContent: He doesn’t seem to be very good at crisis management .
sentences.sCn: 他好像不大擅长处理危机。
